responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Insecure Deserialization in UserData processing"
    analysis: |
      The application uses the java.util library for deserialization of objects in the UserData handling functionality. An attacker can exploit this by sending a specially crafted request that contains malicious object data. When this data is deserialized, it can lead to arbitrary code execution, application crashes, or other unintended behaviors.
    cwe: CWE-502
    function_names:
      - buildUserData
    filenames:
      - jclouds-plugin/src/main/java/jenkins/plugins/jclouds/config/ConfigHelper.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: "Command Injection in Blob Store File Uploads"
    analysis: |
      The application constructs a shell command based on user-supplied input to handle file uploads to a blob store. This input is not properly sanitized, which could allow an attacker to inject additional shell commands. This flaw could be exploited to execute arbitrary commands on the host system under the permissions of the server process. 
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - upload
    filenames:
      - jclouds-plugin/src/main/java/jenkins/plugins/jclouds/blobstore/BlobStoreProfile.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: "Insecure Data Storage of Credentials"
    analysis: |
      The application stores sensitive credential information without proper encryption, directly within configuration files that are accessible. Attackers having access to the file system can read these credentials, leading to further attacks, such as unauthorized access to third-party systems.
    cwe: CWE-522
    function_names:
      - storeCredentials
      - convertCredentials
    filenames:
      - jclouds-plugin/src/main/java/jenkins/plugins/jclouds/internal/CredentialsHelper.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: "Missing Input Validation in Profile Name Field"
    analysis: |
      Input to the profile name field in the blob store configuration is inserted directly into the file system without proper validation. This could be exploited by an attacker to traverse the directory structure, or include malicious commands or scripts.
    cwe: CWE-20
    function_names:
      - doCheckProfileName
    filenames:
      - jclouds-plugin/src/main/java/jenkins/plugins/jclouds/blobstore/BlobStoreLogger.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure Deserialization in UserData processing
leads.analysis: The application uses the java.util library for deserialization of objects in the UserData handling functionality. An attacker can exploit this by sending a specially crafted request that contains malicious object data. When this data is deserialized, it can lead to arbitrary code execution, application crashes, or other unintended behaviors.

leads.headline: Command Injection in Blob Store File Uploads
leads.analysis: The application constructs a shell command based on user-supplied input to handle file uploads to a blob store. This input is not properly sanitized, which could allow an attacker to inject additional shell commands. This flaw could be exploited to execute arbitrary commands on the host system under the permissions of the server process.

leads.headline: Insecure Data Storage of Credentials
leads.analysis: The application stores sensitive credential information without proper encryption, directly within configuration files that are accessible. Attackers having access to the file system can read these credentials, leading to further attacks, such as unauthorized access to third-party systems.

leads.headline: Missing Input Validation in Profile Name Field
leads.analysis: Input to the profile name field in the blob store configuration is inserted directly into the file system without proper validation. This could be exploited by an attacker to traverse the directory structure, or include malicious commands or scripts.
